page.title: 14VILLAGE HALL-INCE BLUNDELL
page.content: The{village hall}is the social centre of the area. The hall was opened in{1957,}as the result of eleven years of hard work by volunteers from the local community. The main building has a dance floor and bar a stage, a modern kitchen, and a comfortable lounge for smaller functions. At the south side there is a men's club. The hall is in use every evening and is used by many local clubs including the Darby and Joan club, the Church Committee, the Youth Club and the Badminton Club. Every Tuesday the hall is used by Ballroom Dancing enthusiasts. Every Sunday there is a social evening and Mass is said here on the first Friday of each month. The village hall{Harvest Supper}and the{New Year's Eve Dance}are two of the most popular annual events.
